commenter_a: HEY OBAMA FORGOT ABOUT THIS LAW......Islam, by law, is prohibited from US immigration The Immigration and Nationality Act passed June 27, 1952 revised the laws relating to immigration, naturalization, and nationality for the United States. That act, which became Public Law 414, established both the law and the intent of Congress regarding the immigration of Aliens to the US and remains in effect today. Among the many issues it covers, one in particular, found in Chapter 2 Section 212, is the prohibition of entry to the US if the Alien belongs to an organization seeking to overthrow the government of the United States by "force, violence, or other unconstitutional means." This, by its very definition, rules out Islamic immigration to the United States, but this law is being ignored by the White House.Islamic immigration to the US would be prohibited under this law because the Koran, Sharia Law and the ...

post_message: For three years, Dallas County Judge Tonya Parker has quietly declined to perform wedding ceremonies. It didn't feel right to exclude some couples from the institution of marriage, she said. Today, all 12 of her fellow district court judges sat inside Parker's courtroom for her first marriage ceremony in years.
